intro: Aporosa agusanensis, commonly known as the Agusan aporosa, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Philippines, specifically found in the mountainous regions of Agusan and other parts of Mindanao. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of primary and secondary forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
